1.text: Rinse your potatoes under warm water rub them clean.

2.text: Peel your potatoes if you want the skin off.

3.text: Cut the potatoes into cubes or slices to speed up the cook time.

4.text: Place your potatoes in a pan or pot and fill it with cold water.

5.text: Add a pinch of salt and turn your stove on high.

6.text: Reduce the heat to low once the water reaches a rolling boil.

7.text: Boil red potatoes, new potatoes, or cubed potatoes for 15-20 minutes.

8.text: Let bigger potatoes boil for 20-25 minutes.

9.text: Test a potato to see if it’s done by poking it with a fork.

10.text: Drain the potatoes in your sink by pouring the pot into a colander.

11.text: Clean your potatoes and peel them if you want the skin off.

12.text: Place your potatoes in a large, microwave-safe bowl and fill it with water.

13.text: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and poke a few holes in the cover.

14.text: Microwave your bowl of potatoes on high for 5 minutes.

15.text: Remove the bowl and stir the potatoes before putting the plastic wrap back.

16.text: Return your potatoes to the microwave for an additional 5 minutes.

17.text: Test a potato to see if it’s done by poking it with a fork.

18.text: Drain your potatoes in a colander and let them cool.
